title: We, Robots: Staying Human in the Age of Big Data by Curtis White
description: https://images.gr-assets.com/books/1472249976l/25937716.jpg In the tradition of Jaron Lanier’s You Are Not a Gadget, a rousing, sharply argued—and, yes, inspiring!—reckoning with our blind faith in technology. Can technology solve all our problems? Despite overwhelming evidence to the contrary, many of our most famous journalists, pundits, and economists seem to think so. According to them, “intelligent machines” and big data will free us from work, educate our children, transform our environment, and even make religion more user-friendly. This is the story they’re telling us: that we should stop worrying and love our robot future. We, Robots: Staying Human in the Age of Big Data by Curtis White English | 280 pages | EPUB | 2.41 MB
